publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1072# Sarah Boyack: World Water Day 2004-That the Parliament recognises the 11th World Water Day on 22 March 2004 as a time to remind everyone of the importance of water for our environment; acknowledges the need to focus attention on the vital need to protect and conserve water resources and supplies of drinking water; believes that in Scotland, the UK and worldwide everyone should have access to water that is safe and affordable; commends continued public ownership of water services in Scotland; notes with concern the situation in Indonesia and Argentina where foreign private ownership of water services has led to unreasonable and excessive water costs beyond the reach of poor households, and further notes with grave concern the suggestion that water may be included in the General Agreement in Trade Services negotiations and that this could lead to the privatisation of water services in Scotland.
